alert.note: Alert for Davis Mountains; Davis Mountains Foothills; Eastern Culberson County; Marfa Plateau; Reeves County Plains; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 3:07PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Reeves, north central Jeff Davis and southeastern Culberson Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 307 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kent, moving west at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kent and Plateau. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 157 and 201. Interstate 20 between mile markers 0 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Davis Mountains; Davis Mountains Foothills; Eastern Culberson County; Marfa Plateau; Reeves County Plains; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor
